availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Son of Rutha Dunning. Married to Sarah J. Haden Dunning in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on October 2, 1831. Father of Mary E. Dunning, Joel H. Dunning, Charles E. Dunning, Henley H. Dunning, Lemuel Dunning, Thomas M. Dunning, Sarah C. Dunning, and William A. H. Dunning. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Pollards Tan Yard in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 359A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 149.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 38.
"Lemuel Dunning (1797-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial #66962639, accessed August 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66962639.
